      Returns a service message with the following format: "GETCHUNK <Version> <SenderID> <FileID> <ChunkNo>".

      Returns a service message with the following format: "INFO <Version> <SenderID> <FileID> <FilePath> <FileName> <ChunkTotal>".

      • createPutchunkMsg

        public byte[] createPutchunkMsg(int peerID,
                                ProtocolState state,
                                java.lang.Long chunkNo)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a service message with the following format: "PUTCHUNK <Version> <SenderID> <FileID> <ChunkNo> <ReplicationDegree>".
        Parameters:
        peerID - the numeric identifier of the sending Peer
        state - the Protocol State object relevant to this operation
        chunkNo - the chunk number relevant to this operation
        Returns:
        the binary data representing the message
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createEmptyChunkMsg

        public byte[] createEmptyChunkMsg(int peerID,
                                  ProtocolState state)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a service message with the following format: "CHUNK <Version> <SenderID> <FileID> <ChunkNo>". No chunk data is sent with this version of the CHUNK message.
        Parameters:
        peerID - the numeric identifier of the sending Peer
        state - the Protocol State object relevant to this operation
        Returns:
        the binary data representing the message
        Throws:

      • createReclaimMsg

        public byte[] createReclaimMsg(int peerID,
                               ProtocolState state)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a service message with the following format: "PUTCHUNK <Version> <SenderID> <FileID> <ChunkNo> <ReplicationDegree>". Used for RECLAIM protocol to send own Peer chunk data instead of accessing original file.
        Parameters:
        peerID - the numeric identifier of the sending Peer
        state - the Protocol State object relevant to this operation
        Returns:
        the binary data representing the message
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createStartedMsg

        public byte[] createStartedMsg(int peerID,
                               java.lang.String protocolVersion)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a service message with the following format: "STARTED <Version> <SenderID>".
        Parameters:
        peerID - the numeric identifier of the sending Peer
        protocolVersion - the backup system version
        Returns:
        the binary data representing the message
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createRetrieveMsg

        public byte[] createRetrieveMsg(int peerID,
                                java.lang.String protocolVersion,
                                java.lang.String file)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a service message with the following format: "RETRIEVE <Version> <SenderID> <FileRequest>".
        Parameters:
        peerID - the numeric identifier of the sending Peer
        protocolVersion - the backup system version
        file - the filepath / filename to lookup
        Returns:
        the binary data representing the message
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createInfoMsg

        public byte[] createInfoMsg(int peerID,
                            java.lang.String protocolVersion,
                            FileInfo info)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a service message with the following format: "INFO <Version> <SenderID> <FileID> <FilePath> <FileName> <ChunkTotal>".
        Parameters:
        peerID - the numeric identifier of the sending Peer
        protocolVersion - the backup system version
        info - the file info to use for creating the message
        Returns:
        the binary data representing the message
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • mergeByte

        private byte[] mergeByte(byte[] arr1,
                         int arr1Len,
                         byte[] arr2,
                         int arr2Len)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Merges two byte arrays by copying from the start of each one up to a specified length for each. The second array is appended to the end of the first one.
        Parameters:
        arr1 - the first array to merge
        arr1Len - the length to merge of the first array
        arr2 - the second array to merge (appended to the first)
        arr2Len - the length to merge of the second array
        Returns:
        the merged byte array
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • appendMAC

        private byte[] appendMAC(byte[] msg)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Appends a MAC to a service message.
        Parameters:
        msg - the service message to append the MAC to
        Returns:
        the service message with MAC appended
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getData

        private int getData(java.lang.String filepath,
                    long chunkNo,
                    byte[] data,
                    boolean encrypted)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Copies a chunk of data to the array provided. Returns the actual amount of bytes read.
        Parameters:
        filepath - the file path of the file to read a chunk from
        chunkNo - the current chunk number
        data - the array to fill
        encrypted - whether the data is encrypted
        Returns:
        the actual number of bytes read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • findHeaderIndices

        private boolean findHeaderIndices(java.net.DatagramPacket packet)
        Uses the header of a service message to find the indices where the header and first line terminate.
        Parameters:
        packet - the packet storing the header
        Returns:
        whether the header is a valid service message

      • validateMAC

        public boolean validateMAC(java.net.DatagramPacket packet)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Verifies that the MAC appended to the service message coincides with the newly computed MAC.
        Parameters:
        packet - the packet to extract the MAC from
        Returns:
        whether the computed MAC and received MAC matched
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • stripHeader

        public java.lang.String[] stripHeader(java.net.DatagramPacket packet)
        Extracts the header from a service message, returning it. If the header is invalid null is returned.
        Parameters:
        packet - the packet to extract the header from
        Returns:
        the header fields, or null if the header is invalid
